channel.title: attack.t1003 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1003 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: Process Dump via Rundll32 and Comsvcs.dll
item.description: Detects a process memory dump performed via ordinal function 24 in comsvcs.dll

item.title: Malicious Service Installations
item.description: Detects known malicious service installs that only appear in cases of lateral movement, credential dumping and other suspicious activity

item.title: Windows Credential Editor
item.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

item.title: Windows Credential Editor Registry
item.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

item.title: SecurityXploded Tool
item.description: Detects the execution of SecurityXploded Tools

item.title: CreateMiniDump Hacktool
item.description: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker’s machine

item.title: Cisco Collect Data
item.description: Collect pertinent data from the configuration files

item.title: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction
item.description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers

item.title: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt
item.description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.

item.title: LSASS Access from Non System Account
item.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account

item.title: Load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL from Suspicious Process
item.description: Detects the load of dbghelp/dbgcore DLL (used to make memory dumps) by suspicious processes. Tools like ProcessHacker and some attacker tradecract use MiniDumpWriteDump API found in dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll. As an example, SilentTrynity C2 Framework has a module that leverages this API to dump the contents of Lsass.exe and transfer it over the network back to the attacker’s machine.

item.title: LSASS Memory Dumping
item.description: Detect creation of dump files containing the memory space of lsass.exe, which contains sensitive credentials. Identifies usage of Sysinternals procdump.exe to export the memory space of lsass.exe which contains sensitive credentials.

item.title: Mimikatz through Windows Remote Management
item.description: Detects usage of mimikatz through WinRM protocol by monitoring access to lsass process by wsmprovhost.exe.

item.title: Judgement Panda Credential Access Activity
item.description: Detects Russian group activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike

item.title: Judgement Panda Exfil Activity
item.description: Detects Judgement Panda activity as described in Global Threat Report 2019 by Crowdstrike

item.title: Activity Related to NTDS.dit Domain Hash Retrieval
item.description: Detects suspicious commands that could be related to activity that uses volume shadow copy to steal and retrieve hashes from the NTDS.dit file remotely

item.title: Cmdkey Cached Credentials Recon
item.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials

item.title: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
item.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)

item.title: NotPetya Ransomware Activity
item.description: Detects NotPetya ransomware activity in which the extracted passwords are passed back to the main module via named pipe, the file system journal of drive C is deleted and windows eventlogs are cleared using wevtutil

item.title: Rubeus Hack Tool
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Rubeus hack tool

item.title: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access
item.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

item.title: Suspicious Use of Procdump
item.description: Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process. This way we’re also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

item.title: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction
item.description: Detects Access to LSASS Process

item.title: Detection of SafetyKatz
item.description: Detects possible SafetyKatz Behaviour

item.title: QuarksPwDump Dump File
item.description: Detects a dump file written by QuarksPwDump password dumper

item.title: WCE wceaux.dll Access
item.description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host

item.title: SAM Dump to AppData
item.description: Detects suspicious SAM dump activity as cause by QuarksPwDump and other password dumpers

item.title: Credentials Dumping Tools Accessing LSASS Memory
item.description: Detects process access LSASS memory which is typical for credentials dumping tools

item.title: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

item.title: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS
item.description: Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage. The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

item.title: Mimikatz Use
item.description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)

item.title: Antivirus Password Dumper Detection
item.description: Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a password dumper

item.title: Cred Dump Tools Dropped Files
item.description: Files with well-known filenames (parts of credential dump software or files produced by them) creation

item.title: Cred Dump-Tools Named Pipes
item.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via specific named pipes

item.title: DIT Snapshot Viewer Use
item.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool. Seems to be a tool for ransomware groups.

item.title: Dumpert Process Dumper
item.description: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory

item.title: Generic Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
item.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask

item.title: LSASS Memory Dump
item.description: Detects process LSASS memory dump using procdump or taskmgr based on the CallTrace pointing to dbghelp.dll or dbgcore.dll for win10

item.title: LSASS Memory Dump File Creation
item.description: LSASS memory dump creation using operating systems utilities. Procdump will use process name in output file if no name is specified

item.title: Mimikatz Command Line
item.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments

item.title: Mimikatz Detection LSASS Access
item.description: Detects process access to LSASS which is typical for Mimikatz (0x1000 PROCESS_QUERY_ LIMITED_INFORMATION, 0x0400 PROCESS_QUERY_ INFORMATION “only old versions”, 0x0010 PROCESS_VM_READ)

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL

item.title: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity - Zeek
item.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL. Based on the SIGMA rules/windows/builtin/win_impacket_secretdump.yml

item.title: Process Dump via Comsvcs DLL
item.description: Detects process memory dump via comsvcs.dll and rundll32

item.title: QuarksPwDump Clearing Access History
item.description: Detects QuarksPwDump clearing access history in hive

item.title: Shadow Copies Access via Symlink
item.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

item.title: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
item.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

item.title: Transfering Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
item.description: Transfering files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares - Zeek
item.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

item.title: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process
item.description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process
